# Chapter 1 - Language Basics

## Output Methods

There are basically two methods used to print information within a program.

| Method              | Description                                   |
|---------------------|-----------------------------------------------|
| Console.Write()     | Prints info on a line.                        |
| Console.WriteLine() | Prints info on a line followed by a new line. |

<br><br>

``` csharp
Console.Write("This is line one.");
Console.Write("This is line two.");
```

::: panel-tabset

## WriteLine()


## Comments

::: {.callout-caution title = "What is a comment ?" icon = false}

-   A comment is a text note that is ignored by a program.

-   It helps document a program for better readability and understanding of logic.

-   It temporarily disables part of a program during debugging.

:::

<br>

::: {.callout-note title = "Types of comments"}

1.  Single-line comment. Begins with /

2.  Multiple-line comment. Begins with /\* and ends with \*/

:::
